#summary Explains how to build the Page Speed native library.

= Prerequisites =

At the moment the Page Speed native library builds using the Chromium build system.

To build Page Speed you will need to install the prerequisite software for your platform:

  # [http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/build-instructions-windows#TOC-Prerequisite-software Windows]
  # [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/MacBuildInstructions Mac OS X]
  # [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxBuildInstructionsPrerequisites Linux].

Regardless of platform, you will need to install the Chromium [http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/install-gclient depot tools].

= Sync the code =

  # `gclient config http://page-speed.googlecode.com/svn/lib/trunk/src`
  # `gclient sync --force`

= How to build =

On Windows, using Visual Studio, open the `all.sln` file in the `build` subdirectory, and build the solution.

On Mac OS X, navigate to the `build` directory and invoke `xcodebuild -project all.xcodeproj -activeconfiguration -target All`.

On Linux, navigate to the `build` directory and invoke `hammer`.
